title: Provides that the department of education of the city of New York shall provide school bus service for students in grades K through 6 who live 1/2 mile or more away
summary: Provides that the department of education of the city of New York shall provide school bus service for students in grades K through 6 who live 1/2 mile or more from school.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2051

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 13, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. CUSICK, TITONE -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Education

       AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the  city  of  New  York,  in
         relation  to  requiring the department of education of the city of New
         York to provide school bus service to students in grades  kindergarten
         through six  who reside one-half mile or more from school

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision b of section 19-606 of the administrative  code
    2  of  the city of New York, as added by local law number 48 of the city of
    3  New York for the year 2000, is amended and  a  new  subdivision  a-1  is
    4  added to read as follows:
    5    A-1.  THE  DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION SHALL PROVIDE SCHOOL BUS SERVICE TO
    6  ALL GENERAL EDUCATION STUDENTS WHO LIVE ONE-HALF MILE OR MORE  FROM  THE
    7  SCHOOL  THEY  ATTEND  AND  WHO ARE ENROLLED IN A GRADE FROM KINDERGARTEN
    8  THROUGH SIX, INCLUSIVE.
    9    b. The [board] DEPARTMENT of education shall prepare and, when  neces-
   10  sary,  revise  two  school bus service plans annually to ensure that all
   11  students eligible to receive school bus service to and from the  schools
   12  they  legally  attend shall be provided with a seat on a school bus. One
   13  plan shall relate to school  bus  service  to  be  provided  during  the
   14  session of the school year beginning in September and ending in June and
   15  one  plan  shall  relate  to  school bus service to be provided during a
   16  summer school session. Each plan shall be prepared prior  to  the  first
   17  day  of  the  session  of  the school year to which it relates and shall
   18  include the following information: (i) the criteria used by the  [board]
   19  DEPARTMENT  of  education  to determine whether a student is eligible to
   20  receive school bus service; (ii) for each school, a summary  description
   21  of the school bus routes servicing the school; (iii) for each school bus
   22  route, the number of students eligible to ride on the school bus operat-
   23  ing  on  the  route and the maximum seating capacity of such school bus;

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01966-01-1

       A. 2051                             2

    1  and (iv) any other information the [board] DEPARTMENT of education deems
    2  relevant. Upon completion of the plans, they shall be submitted  to  the
    3  mayor and the speaker of the city council.
    4    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education of the city of New York to provide school bus service to students in grades kindergarten through six who reside one-half mile or more from school
